CIRCULAR NO – 23 / 99 
 
No. CAS-5 (4)/99-Div-I 
 
 
 
 
Dated : 23.12.1999 
 
 
Subject:    Communication system in event of any Incident 
Occurring at civil airports in India 
 
 
 
In accordance with Standard 3.1.3. Of Annex 17 of ICAO, Commissioner of 
Security, Civil Aviation (COSCA), Bureau of Civil Aviation Security has been 
designated 
as 
appropriate 
authority 
that 
is 
responsible 
for 
the 
development, 
Implementation and maintenance of the National Civil Aviation Security Programme. 
 
2. 
In view of the above mandatory requirement, it is a matter of paramount 
importance that the appropriate authority is well informed abut any incident which has 
direct or Indirect impact on overall security of aviation operations.  As of now, there is no 
standard system of communicating Information relating to any incidents that occur at 
airports. 
 
3. 
The following procedure should, henceforth, be followed to communicate 
information pertaining to any incident which occur at airports:- 
 
(a) 
 Shift Airport Manager, Airports Authority of India (IAD) of Delhi, 
Mumbai, Calcutta & Chennai Airports shall inform, without any loss of 
time, to the Bomb Detection & Disposal Squad (BDDS) Control Room of 
BCAS located at these airports.
2:
(b) 
With regard to other airports, the Air Traffic Controller 9ATC) of the 
concerned airport will inform the FIC of the Region who in turn will 
inform the concerned BDDS Control Room i.e., BDDS Control Rooms at 
Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata & Chennai.  IFC Guwahati will inform the BDDS 
Control Room at Calcutta. 
 
(c) 
Police Control Room manned by Airport Security Police at Delhi, 
Mumbai, Calcutta & Chennai airports will inform the RDCOS, BCAS at 
respective location as well as BDDS Control Room. 
 
(d) 
In charge, Control Room of BDDS will inform to all concerned RDCOS, 
DCOS (BDDS) and COE who in turn will inform the Commissioner of 
Security (CA), Addl. Commissioner of Security (CA) and the officer on 
special duty (Int) in the BCAS Hqrs. 
 
4. 
After giving the first hand information as enumerated above, maximum details of 
the incident shall be collected and communicated to the COSCA, Addl. COSCA and 
OSD (I) on phone followed by preliminary report by fax and detailed report by sped post 
/ fax. 
 
5. 
The details of such incident should also be reflected in the weekly monthly report 
in a separate column. 
 
 
 
This issues with the approval of Commissioner of Security (CA). 
 
 (P.MOHANAN) 
OFFICER ON SPECIAL DUTY (INT)
